content.webTitle: Sailing: Roxy gathers speed to move into sixth place

fields.headline: Roxy gathers speed to move into sixth place
fields.bodyText: Samantha Davies's Roxy, the leading British competitor in the Vendée Globe solo race around the world, has moved into sixth place, having passed the damaged Paprec-Virbac 2. But Davies is still 1,200 miles behind fifth-placed Vincent Riou and 1,900 astern of leader Michel Desjoyeaux on Foncia. Desjoyeaux has been achieving incredible speeds on his way to Cape Horn, 1,500 miles away, exceeding 400 miles in 24 hours. Davies, in an older boat, is a touch slower but said: "It is very hard to keep a balance. I am always in 'kick ass' mode, but I try to be careful and maintain good average speeds. I don't talk to my boat but I talk to Chuck, my auto pilot."
